response: "I can't escape this constant pressure to be perfect. It's suffocating me."
"Why does society expect me to have it all together? I feel like I'm losing my mind trying to meet these impossible standards."
"Everyone else seems to have it figured out, but I'm just stumbling through life. Am I the only one feeling this way?"
"I'm starting to question my worth and value because I can't seem to meet society's expectations. It's driving me insane."
"I'm constantly comparing myself to others, and it's driving me crazy. I can't help but feel like I'm never good enough."
"Every time I make progress, it feels like society moves the goalposts. I'm losing touch with reality, trying to keep up with this ever-changing standard of perfection."
"I'm exhausted from pretending to have it all together. It's like a never-ending game I can't win."
"I've become so obsessed with perfection that I can't even enjoy the little moments anymore. It's like I'm living in a constant state of anxiety."
"I wish I could break free from society's expectations and focus on what truly matters. This pressure is driving me insane."
"I'm losing sight of who I am because I'm so consumed by this need to be flawless. I don't even recognize myself anymore."
